flow.descriptionCdata:
5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.0a17948e-a14d-41bf-bb4c-1dadf8946ba9.prompt=Password of SA user. 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.0a821fa8-929f-49fe-9a88-f6b0f1093dab.prompt=User Identifier 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.1b7b1b91-8ee1-4ee0-a2cf-9c06481279c1.prompt=Process Instance ID 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.28fe1335-c7b7-42d6-8afa-3543164dc27f.prompt=User Identifier 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.3c9c2eaa-ca70-4806-aa6f-88788d35fcac.description=
This operation can be used to find the SA version in the form of 'sasXXX' (Similar to the entries in the Selection List 'SAS Version'). Output of this operations  could be mapped to the input parameter 'coreVersion' which is used in other SA Operations. For SA version 6.x, this operation is not supported. For other SA versions, if the output variable 'coreVersion' is reported with 'UNKNOWN', then user is recommended to manually find the SA version to use in other SA Operations.

Inputs\:
coreHost - IP Address or DNS name of the SA Web Service.
corePort - HTTP(S) port of SA Web Service. By default it is '443'.
coreProtocol - HTTP / HTTPS. By default it is 'HTTPS'.
coreUsername - Username of the SA.
corePassword - Password of SA user.

Outputs\:
status - Operation completion Status.
coreVersion - SA version.  It could be one of [sas7, sas75, sas78, sas9, sas91, UNKNOWN].

Responses\:
success - retrieved successfully
failure - failed to retrieve data
5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.4dd7cde0-fa7e-497b-b8ba-5eb7e8f4c440.prompt=Enter a value for coreUsername 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.57df1be5-fed0-450a-a9ab-a4a6ec34c54a.prompt=Enter a value for policyName 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.650fcb9d-a25b-4d9d-9ab2-26b2a81c456c.prompt=Enter a value for coreHost 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.66d82bdf-a489-4866-9593-b051f27dda5d.prompt=Enter a value for serverId 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.6aeb59d3-50d0-422d-8dc7-e5961c61e9dc.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.7400757e-49a5-4c9b-8e6d-7414d6bd8546.prompt=Enter a value for coreUsername 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.74379645-65a4-494e-90c6-7a9b6a0d02ce.prompt=Username of the SA. 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.80f3534e-ef2d-433e-8f03-7da66f5621a4.prompt=Process Instance ID 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.93375631-df4b-46fa-b057-059c1bcf0b9d.description=Starts a remediation on the given server using a set of attached/detached software policies. If the software policies information is not provided, then a full software policy remediation is performed. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The name of the server to remediate. serverId - The ID of the server to remediate. If provided, the server name is ignored. softwarePoliciesNames - The names of the software policies to remediate against (separated by comma). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. softwarePoliciesIDs - The IDs of the software policies to remediate against (separated by comma). The software policies need to be attached/detached to/from the server before the remediation takes place. If this input is provided, then 'softwarePoliciesNames' is ignored. wait - An integer value specifying how many milliseconds should be waited for the job to finish. If not specified the job is started, but may not have finished. rebootOption - Reboot Option for Remediating a server. It could be one of [suppress, per_action, at_end] or it can be left blank. Where\: - suppress - Suppress all reboots; - per_action - Reboot after each installation or uninstallation; - at_end - Reboot at the end of remediation; - left blank (no value provided) - Reboot as specified by individual software items. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. Returns\: returnResult - The id of the created job. 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.9f260984-986d-41fa-8618-68a7779e28ae.description=
Iterates through a list of values. Modifying the value of the list and delimiter inputs during iteration is not generally supported.

Inputs\:
list - The list to iterate through.
separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list.

Returns\:
The current element of the list, if the response is has more

Responses\:
has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned.
has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list.
failure - failed to process the list.

Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously.

WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration.
5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.b81a747c-299d-470e-9ab7-94b2857fecb8.prompt=Enter a value for attachableName 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.bfa3dedf-1db9-4190-96b7-5192df448aa3.prompt=Enter a value for coreHost 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.cdb0e116-ed36-43d6-9859-b38458f6ff4e.description=Attaches a software policy to a server/device group/hypervisor. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. policyName - The name of the policy to attach. policyID - The ID of the policy to attach. If this input is provided, then 'policyName' is ignored. attachableName - The name of the attachable object to attach the policy to. attachableID - The ID of the attachable object to attach the policy to. If this input is provided, then 'attachableName' is ignored. attachableType - The type of the attachable object. Can be\: SERVER, DEVICE_GROUP, HYPERVISOR. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. failure - Something went wrong. 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.da98b200-dd5f-4429-813a-bc0061a3fb43.prompt=IP Address or DNS name of the SA Web Service. 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.e672ab87-cbcc-449a-bc16-4d2196686b81.prompt=Enter a value for serverName 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.ea269f7d-7663-4c7a-a8d6-c7a94b961674.prompt=Enter a value for corePassword 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.eb0d250f-63f8-4586-8349-3e3a68ea4a4d.description=This workflow updates the Process Instance State using PEM API. Inputs\: _PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID - Process Instance Id _processInstanceState - Process Instance State (Use value from selection list CSA-ProcessInstance-State) Result\: _processInstanceState -Updated Process Instance State 5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.eb3525ee-888b-4b31-9178-20c9bf8dd54e.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Returns\:
The the value of the context variable it appended to.

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
5720844f-9b4d-4308-a6a9-9605fa5f5835.fc4264c4-c4ec-4361-80f3-8c05dfee918c.prompt=Enter a value for corePassword
flow.name: Apply Software Policies

staticBinding.value: Failed to remediate the software policy ${saPolicyName} on server ${hostName}
Failed to attach software policy ${saPolicyName} on server ${hostName}
